actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-929, by Mr. Gordon.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 2834. Upon adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to consider the conference report on the bill and all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration shall be waived. The conference report shall be considered as having been read when call up for consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 205.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the conference report on the bill (S. 2834) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1991 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, for the Intelligence Community Staff, for the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes, and against its consideration.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on S. 2834 (intelligence and intelligence-related activities funding).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the conference report on the bill (S. 2834) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1991 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, for the Intelligence Community Staff, for the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes, and against its consideration.
